channel.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
channel.description:
Hello, at first i'd like to thank you all for even reading this.
I have just started a server etc. All very nice etc. But when i made my self admin, and tried to use a command. It says i need to use the reserve apostrofe key (`) under the ESC key.
So when i do that, the development console opens. But when i typ ::commands, or just commands there happens nothing. Everything i typ, like help, ::help, !help. Nothing works.
Can someone explain how to use this?
Thank you! :D

item.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @xhavefunx xhavefunx
item.description:
@xhavefunx wrote:

Aha, i have found something out.

Commands like “Home” are working, and “Kbd”. ( In the development console! )

But commands like “Train” are not…

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @laurent_248 laurent 248
item.description:
@laurent_248 wrote:

naw commandscreenhandler is the commandpackethandler on Final Creed and Final Creed’s base. U don’t need to search a CommandScreenHandler.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @xhavefunx xhavefunx
item.description:
@xhavefunx wrote:

[quote=“laurent 248, post:6, topic:366644”]please, go in commandpackethandler, and check the commands ur able to use.

theres a command name i got from my server, search for something like this.

				if(cmd[0].equals("giveparty")) {

giveparty is the command.

If u are using my source or atomic-scape or any base like that–pk base, search for commandscreenhandler.

I hope i helped ya! :D[/quote]

Hello Laurent, thanks for your help!

I actually found all the commands that are able to be used in my server.
I found a command that all people can use, ( example:

} if(cmd[0].equals("demon")) { player.getTele().ancientTelePlayer(player,2085 ,4464 , 0, 2); }

And a command that only the crew can use:

}
if(cmd[0].equals("jail")) {
       Player other = World.getInstance().getPlayerList().get(World.getInstance().getIdFromName(command.substring((command.indexOf(" ") + 1))));
        if (other != null) {
                         other.tele(2397, 9602, 0);
                         other.isTeleBlocked = true;
                         other.sm("You have been jailed for child mollestation.");  
       }

Unfortionaly, i am using Painzone’s 562 script.
I tried to find a commandscreenhandler but dind’t found one.

Do you know in what case “Commandscreenhandler” is in an 562 server?

Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @laurent_248 laurent 248
item.description:
@laurent_248 wrote:

please, go in commandpackethandler, and check the commands ur able to use.

theres a command name i got from my server, search for something like this.

				if(cmd[0].equals("giveparty")) {

giveparty is the command.

If u are using my source or atomic-scape or any base like that–pk base, search for commandscreenhandler.

I hope i helped ya!

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @xhavefunx xhavefunx
item.description:
@xhavefunx wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:4, topic:366644”]I don’t know nothing about deobs over 508 to be honest. However, I do know that the commands for example only 562 + is requiring a interface to be able to get items for example.

Deob doesn’t mean much, just means the cache or whatever.

You will have to program the commands in; in order to use them on the screen that pops up.[/quote]

Well, so i will have to copy the regular commands to the development console ( screen that pops up ) ?

If the code’s are same, then alright. But where do i have to put them?

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

I don’t know nothing about deobs over 508 to be honest. However, I do know that the commands for example only 562 + is requiring a interface to be able to get items for example.

Deob doesn’t mean much, just means the cache or whatever.

You will have to program the commands in; in order to use them on the screen that pops up.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @xhavefunx xhavefunx
item.description:
@xhavefunx wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:2, topic:366644”]You must be using a deob over 562 obviously for a screen like that. I’ve used that screen before, so I’ll try to help out as much as I can.

You have to open that screen (good), and then you have to type in for example
::item 4151 1 (I don’t remember if you have to include the ::, so try both if that doesn’t work)

You have to remember if one command doesn’t work; then you have add that command to work.[/quote]

I really apreciate your help!
There is one problem: I can’t code at all

Can you explain what you mean with “deob” ?

It would be enough for me to use the regular commands when i’m an admin.
And the console doesn’t reconize those commands, do you how to use those commands as a admin?
Commands like ::home etc. It would be nice to use them as a adminXD

Thank you!

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Development Console [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

You must be using a deob over 562 obviously for a screen like that. I’ve used that screen before, so I’ll try to help out as much as I can.

You have to open that screen (good), and then you have to type in for example
::item 4151 1 (I don’t remember if you have to include the ::, so try both if that doesn’t work)

You have to remember if one command doesn’t work; then you have add that command to work.

Read full topic

Hello, at first i’d like to thank you all for even reading this.

I have just started a server etc. All very nice etc. But when i made my self admin, and tried to use a command. It says i need to use the reserve apostrofe key (`) under the ESC key.

So when i do that, the development console opens. But when i typ ::commands, or just commands there happens nothing. Everything i typ, like help, ::help, !help. Nothing works.

Can someone explain how to use this?

Thank you!
